info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 11:37PM CDT until July 21 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Bismarck ND
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central North Dakota, including the following counties, Burleigh and Morton.
* WHEN...Until 1215 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may be impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms produced between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain this evening in central and southern portions of the Bismarck Mandan metro area. Urban and small stream flooding is expected to continue through around midnight. Additional rain is possible after midnight, but at this time it appears rainfall rates will be much lower. - Additional rainfall amounts less than a half inch are expected. However it will take some time for current flooding to work it's way through local drainage routes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bismarck, Mandan, Lincoln and Fort Abraham Lincoln State Park.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT MONDAY
